txt.en:
You have found the source of the howling sound! It's not a fearsome beast at all, but a scared and possibly injured hound.

He growls at you in the language of canines, which you understand thanks to your Beorning heritage.

'Who are you?! You don't smell like a Ranger! I don't know you, stay away!'

You should try to calm it down and then return to Mablung.

'Did you hear that, [placeholder]? That howling sound has been spooking the horses and making the men uneasy.

'We have not yet located the wretched beast, but I know I would like to see the noise ended. The more sleep we get before the march, the better.

'Let me know if you find it while you're out in the Noman-lands. It sounded as if it was coming from the hills west of here.'
Mablung would like you to work with Faroth to complete quests in the Noman-lands.\n\nIf you should get separated from your hound, blow the hound-calling whistle to summon him back.
Faroth discovered a Hidden Orkish Trap!
Mablung would like you to work with Faroth to complete quests in the Noman-lands.\n\nIf you should get separated from your hound, blow the hound-calling whistle to summon him back.
Completed quest 'Stalker of the Scrublands' with Faroth
Complete quest 'Sniff Them Out' with Faroth
Mablung can be found in the Camp of the Host, on the northern edge of North Ithilien.\n\nNow that Faroth's work in the Noman-lands is finished, you should return to Mablung.
Complete quest 'Stalker of the Scrublands' with Faroth
The source of the howling sound was actually an injured hound.\n\nYou should find a way to calm the injured hound.
Mablung can be found in the Camp of the Host, on the northern edge of North Ithilien.\n\nThe hound has returned to the Camp of the Host. You should return to Mablung and tell him of your success.

You have found the source of the howling sound! It's not a fearsome beast at all, but a scared and possibly injured hound. Does he belong to the Rangers?\n\nYou should try to calm it down and then return to Mablung.

'So this was the source of the howling. Ah, Faroth, old boy! When you went missing, we thought you were gone for good.'

Mablung looks closely at the hound. 

'He must have run afoul of those Orkish traps. It must have been a lucky scrape, for he is well on better already. I think he will be on the look-out for those from now on!

'In truth, I have work for this little Ranger. He has taken a liking to you, it seems. Perhaps you would go with him on his rounds in the Noman-lands, [placeholder]?'
Find the source of the howling sound
Mablung, Captain of the Rangers of Ithilien, would like you to find the source of the howling sound that has been bothering the men in the Camp of the Host.
The calmed hound heads for the Camp of the Host
Completed quest 'Sniff Them Out' with Faroth
He thought it sounded like it was coming from the hills to the west of the Camp of the Host, in the Noman-lands.\n\nMablung has asked you to find the source of the howling sound.
Faroth deserves some praise from all his hard work! Why don't you give him a pat?\n\nIf you should get separated from your hound, blow the hound-calling whistle to summon him back.
Faroth barks at you in the language of canines:\n\n'That was such fun, [placeholder]! Thank you for rescuing me and for taking me on an adventure!'
Faroth looks up at you happily. It seems he enjoys life as a Ranger hound!
Talk with Faroth to part ways for now.\n\nIf you should get separated from your hound, blow the hound-calling whistle to summon him back.
<rgb=#FF00FF>Pat</rgb> Faroth because he's a good dog
'Very good! You two have completed all the work I have for you this day. Faroth has proved himself quite capable, hasn't he? He deserves some praise!'
